ovdesc.p: The Group Interest allows the specification of a calculation method of debit/credit interest for groups of accounts and provides the link to the GENERAL.CHARGE table where the charges applicable to the same groups of Accounts are specified. Account groups are determined automatically on the basis of Customer and Account details such as Residence, Sector, Account Category and Currency. At the time of Account input, reference is made to ACCT.GEN.CONDITION and CONDITION PRIORITY (Ref: General Tables) tables.
- Interest can be calculated on a Daily, Average, or Highest balance basis using value dated balances.
- Rates can be fixed or linked to Basic Rates plus or minus a Margin.

- Different rates can be specified for different balance levels and may be linked to the same or different basic rates. The rates may apply to the whole of the balance or to the part between two balance levels.

Defines named values to indicate if an option applies to the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE. More than one option can be associated with the NR.ATTRIBUTE, with certain restrictions.
Valid Inputs are NEGOTIABLE, NON-NEGOTIABLE, OVERRIDE, FIX-VALUE, MANDATORY as described below: -
NEGOTIABLE
The value of NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE can be negotiated at the arrangement level.
NON-NEGOTIABLE
The value of NON-NEGOTIABLE will indicate that the associated NR.ATTRIBUTE cannot be negotiated at the arrangement level. Both NEGOTIABLE and NON-NEGOTIABLE cannot be defined together
OVERRIDE
Specifies if a default override message should be generated if the default attribute is amended at the arrangement level. If OVERRIDE is not specified, no override will be generated.
FIX-VALUE
Specified if the field value is to be fixed at the arrangement level. If FIX-VALUE is not specified the field value will vary with the changes to the underlying product condition.
MANDATORY
Specifies if the attribute is mandatory for this product condition. Can only be specified where the attribute is not defined as mandatory in the property class.
Defines whether debit interest should be netted against the credit interest prior to calculating tax.

If this is set to Y (yes) then the debit interest due in the capitalisation period will be offset against the credit interest when tax is calculated. Note CR will be netted with DR and CR2 with DR2 and tax calculated individualy. Also the debit interest capitalisation frequency must match the credit in order for the netting to take place.

Indicates the type of rounding to apply to individual credit interest calcualtions, i.e. the amount stored in the CR.INT.AMT field of either INFO.ACCT.CR, ACCR.ACCT.CR or STMT.ACCT.CR (or ...CR2).
The default is to perform natural rounding relevant to the currency of the interest amount.

NONE indicates that no rounding is to be applied to the caclculated interest amount. In this case the total interest will be the sum of the unrounded amounts, and then the total interest will be rounded.
Any other value should be the key to an EB.ROUNDING.RULE record. This record will determine the type of rounding to be applied to the calculated interest amount.
Take the example of a currency with 2 decimal places, where the interest amounts are unrounded and the total is naturally rounded.
The total interest will be 6.999 which will be naturally rounded to 7.00.
Now perform the same calculation with the interest amounts naturally rounded.
total interest will be 6.99.
Alphanumeric field, can be:-
blank = default natural rounding
NONE = interest amount not rounded
key to EB.ROUNDING.RULE to determine the type of rounding to apply.
